page.title: 02The River Test.
page.content: One of the best known rivers for fishing flows through the town,this is the River Test.It is famous for it's trout.The river is a good river for trout because it flows over the chalk beds which make the water clean and pure. The Test begins at Ashe a village to the East of Overton.By the time it has reached Whitchurch it is already quite wide,about four to five metres.If you visit the river here you can see many trout in the river if you are patient. The river is one of the reasons why Whitchurch grew up where it did.It was a suitable site for a mill,and there have been a number of mills in the area for many hundreds of years.The most famous of the mills in Whitchurch is the Silk Mill.
